name: Sea View House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed three nights at Sea View House in Doolin. What a great place! Darra and Niall are wonderful hosts and the location couldn't have been better. Doolin is a wonderful little town and a great place to use as a base to explore the area. Darra was most helpful in suggesting where to go and what to see, even making reservations for us on a boat trip to the Cliffs of Moher. Our room was clean and comfortable, giving us a good night's rest each night we were there. And the view...from the front rooms we had a picture post card view of the village and the sea in the distance. The breakfast selection was wonderful with both a buffet and made to order choices. You won't go hungry here. If you're planning a stay in Doolin I would highly recommend Sea View House. We would definitely stay no where else if we return to Doolin.
reviews.title: Great stay, great view in Doolin

reviews.text: If you want to see the Cliffs of Moher, you must stay that the Sea View House. You walk right out of your room onto the hiking trail for the cliffs. My friend and I hiked for hours and saw the most beautiful views. We went back to the room, freshened up, then went right across the street to Gus O'Connor's Pub for dinner, drinks, and traditional Irish music. In the morning, the lady of the house served us a delicious breakfast! I tried kippers for the first time and realized I really like them. The owners were so hospitable and the home is so cozy. We could not have asked for more in our stay!
reviews.title: The Perfect Stay

reviews.text: We stayed two nights and enjoyed our stay very much. The beginning of the trail to the Cliffs is right in front of the house.
reviews.title: Great location close to cliffs trail / wonderful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also the stores and restaurants are a short walk away.
reviews.title: Fantastic View, Great Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners were friendly and the breakfast options were great. We came in later than expected so called ahead, no problem. Very accommodating.
reviews.title: Can't wait to return
Lovely!
reviews.text: This was my favorite part of our Irish Vacation! Beautiful little town on the sea, Lovely B&B, lovely hosts, The new Burren Way to the Cliffs of Moher is literally footsteps away. Or, 10 minute walk to the ferry. My view of the little village, the sea, the fields was something out of a dream! Loved sitting on the deck and enjoying the Irish music from the Pub just below and the cool sea breeze. Breakfast was wonderful, fresh eggs, all homemade...delicious! Sea View is a must!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights and we had a great time at the Seaview House; the B & B was in a perfect spot elevated above the village of Doolin. It had lovely furnishings and our room was very clean and pleasant with views of the sea and the village of Doolin. Breakfast was excellent with homemake yogurt, fresh fruit, freshly laid eggs by their own hens, fresh baked muffins and bread and part of the enormous spread was your own made to order Irish breakfast, with several great options. We were within a short walk of Doolin with its shops and where we enjoyed two tasty meals at Gus O'Connor's live Irish music pub. Darra and family were most welcoming and she was a mine of information and most helpful with information on what to do and on her advice she booked our boat trip to the Aran Islands which was so magical and on our way back to Doolin pier, the boat took us for a cruise under the Cliffs of Moher. If we return to the area, we will definitely stay at this lovely B&B.
reviews.title: Welcoming Doolin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Darra and Niall know how to make your stay a most pleasant one. They are welcoming, knowledgeable and personable. Your every want and need will be taken care of. We just spent our second visit to Sea View House. It has been 4 years since we were here and it was like coming home. The rooms are lovely. The bathrooms sparkle. The breakfast is unbelievable with everything homemade (brown bread, banana bread, jelly, yogurt, and even eggs from their chickens and ducks)! They go above and beyond. They cannot seem to do enough for you. Sea View House is definitely THE place to stay in Doolin.
reviews.title: Sea View House is THE place to stay in Doolin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an amazing stay at Sea View House this past June. It was our first stop in an 8 day tour of Ireland. Darra is the hostess with the mostess. She not only prepares and serves incredible breakfasts, she never stops making sure your stay is perfect. Helped us with so many of our travel details and even helped to get our money refunded from an excursion. The guest rooms were quite nice and very clean. Had everything we needed for a quiet night's sleep. Bathrooms were nicely updated and plenty of room to enjoy our stay. There are A LOT of B & B's to choose from in Ireland and there's a reason the Sea View House has little vacancy. Close to everything you'll need while in Doolin. Walking distance to all shopping/restaurants/entertainment. A beautiful view and close enough to walk to the Cliffs! Book your accommodations here, you won't be disappointed!
reviews.title: Delightful

reviews.text: What a place for the last night in Ireland. Stunning view, very pleasant room, delightful hosts, delicious breakfast and Irish coffee offered on arrival. The Cliffs of Moher are breathtaking. We wholeheartedly recommend this accommodation.
reviews.title: Excellent last night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We began a two week trip around Ireland on July 10th at this sweet place that was maybe 300m up the river from the ocean. The view from the porch was amazing; the hills behind you, the ocean in front, the Cliffs of Moher beginning to rise from the ocean just to the left. The hosts were great. We arrived at Shannon early in the morning and drove over. The room was ready when we got there, even though it was before noon. They called down to Doolin2Aran Ferries and set us up on a trip out to Inis Oir and then to the Cliffs that was great and recommended places to eat when we got back. The next morning, they drew out a route through the Burren that made the trip up to Galway nothing short of a joy.
reviews.title: Great Start

reviews.text: What a lovely way to experience the charm of Ireland on your first visit to the country. The hostess greeted us with homemade lemonade and cookies. Beautiful location. Room was lovely and well "fitted" out. Appreciated all the helpful ideas for sites to see, pubs to visit, and even some things to do upon leaving the Doolin area and heading towards Killarney. Breakfast was wonderful. Many choices and all prepared and presented nicely. Wish we could have stayed longer. Will definitely stay here again if I return to Ireland in the future.
reviews.title: First Time in Ireland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Exellent Hosts. Very informative on the area and willing to make our stay as good as possable. The views and location are excellent. Lots of small perks and annemitties that we did not use but are not offered elsewhere. Really felt truely welcome.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband has stayed here several times and a recent trip here was my first. The location is wonderful, just across the street from pub, restaurant, and shops. Also, the trail to the Cliffs of Moher is right up the way. The room was perfectly lovely. It was very clean and well stocked. Just what you would expect from a family run B&B. The owner greeted us with a fresh pot of tea when we told him we had just arrived from a long overseas trip, which was a nice touch. The lady of the house even loaned me her rain coat when I told her I had neglected to bring one. We highly recommend the cliff walk with Pat. He's incredibly knowledgable and full of stories. The hike is not for the faint of heart, but you can catch a bus back, so that's a huge plus.
reviews.title: Amazing Breakfast, Wonderful Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One minor note, if you are arriving from a long international flight and plan to drive straight to Doolin, do not take the directions on the B&B website. It takes you on a beautiful coastal road, but the road is extremely narrow and not easy to navigate especially if you are working on little sleep and jet lag. There is a much faster and more direct route through Lisdonvarna (sp?), but check a map. Save the coastal road for the way back after you rest up in the beautiful Sea View!
reviews.title: GREAT Hosts...Great location.....Amazing Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for only one night, but we were treated exceptionally well, but also given our privacy. We were greeted with Irish coffee, lemonade, cookies, and some great suggestions on what do do and where to eat. We wish that we had more time here... we'd have hiked to the Cliffs of Moher rather than driven, but regardless, our wandering of the town, the pubs, the stores, and the coast were very much enjoyed. The bedroom was clean and comfortable; breakfast was excellent. The finishing touch was the coffee-to-go at the door as we headed for the car. Loved it here. Thank you very much!
reviews.title: A fantastic spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Darra, our host was terrific and her husband a great chef! Very convenient to the town & the ferry to the Arran Islands. Beautiful & comfortable room, Wifi and wonderful views. We would highly recommend this B&B!
reviews.title: Perfect Choice in Doolin!

reviews.text: We stayed just for a night in June 2013. The hosts were very friendly. The house is in a great location just a few hundred feet from the downtown of Fisherstreet and an easy walk to Doolin for dinner. Breakfast was awfully tasty.
reviews.title: Lovely B and B and family, terrific breakfast

reviews.text: Our party of 4 stayed one night and we had a WONDERFUL time at the Seaview House; the rooms were beautiful; the breakfast was excellent with homemake yogurt, fresh fruit, fresh baked muffins and bread and made to order Irish breakfast! We were in walking distance of Doolin were we enjoyed an excellent lunch right across the bridge from the Seaview and enjoyed the shops and pub. We enjoyed the Seaview's deck were we spent time reading, relaxing and soaking up some sun; and just enjoyed the day drifting by. Darra and family was most welcoming and most helpful with information on our upcoming stay on Inis Mor, the largest of the Aran Islands. We will come back again to stay at this lovely B&B with Darra and family.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay - Best B&B in Doolin - June-2013

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: J.M. and Family
reviews.title: Perfect experience

description: Welcome to Doolin's finest Bed & Breakfast. Sea View House is spectacularly located on a hillside overlooking the Atlantic Ocean, the Allie River and the beautiful Doolin countryside. Graded by the AA as 4 Star Guest Accommodation, we offer luxurious guest rooms and gourmet breakfasts. Less than one hour from Shannon Airport, Sea View House is a perfect home base while touring the west of Ireland, honeymoons, business travel or your first and last night's stay.
